page.title: 16SOUTHEND PARKS (NORTH)
page.content: {PRIORY PARK.}Originally grounds of Cluniac priory dating from 1110 A.D. Given to the town in 1917 by R.JONES. Refectory and Prior's chamber remain and now act as museum.Park is 31acs with old priory fishponds used for angling -pike-,walled rose garden where old cloisters,wooded walks, tennis courts,bowling greens,cafe,car park,games pitches, childrens' play ground.Annual bowls festival.1985 site of first Southend Festival. {CHALKWELL PARK.}27acs bought in 1903 at a cost Â£20,000.Old Hall and grounds H.Q. 3 cricket clubs and has staged county cricket.Small zoo,cafe, tennis courts,large rose gardens. {PRITTLEBROOK.}Small west east stream prone to flood now laid out as wooded walk from Priory park to Belfairs wood {CHURCHILL GARDENS.}Landscaped old clay pit.Wooded and much vandalised.
